text.dispatch: Respond to the simulation lab for an unresponsive adult who collapsed during training. You are requested to perform high-performance CPR with AED integration.
text.gi: The manikin is supine on the floor. Bystanders report a sudden collapse. Chest rise is absent and there is no response to verbal or painful stimuli.

injects.name: AED powered on and pads applied
Prepare to stop for rhythm check

sample.s: Patient is pulseless and apneic. No spontaneous movement.
sample.a: No known drug allergies per training log.
sample.m: Medication history unavailable for this drill.
sample.p: Simulated history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia.
sample.l: Last oral intake simulated as lunch 2 hours prior to collapse.
sample.e: Participant collapsed while practicing drills; AED prompts should guide the resuscitation.

opqrst.p: No palliation or provocation noted in simulation notes.
opqrst.t: Collapse occurred approximately 1 minute before EMS arrival.

treatments.label: High-Quality CPR
treatments.urgentMsg: Maintain compressions at 100-120/min with full recoil.

prompts.title: Power on and pad placement
prompts.content: Unit on. Stay calm. Remove clothing from the chest. Attach pads to the patient's bare chest as shown. If needed, plug in the pads connector.

prompts.title: Analyzing rhythm
prompts.content: Do not touch the patient. Analyzing heart rhythm.

prompts.title: Stand clear
prompts.content: Stand clear. Do not touch the patient. Press the flashing shock button now.

prompts.title: Post-shock CPR
prompts.content: Shock delivered. Begin CPR. Push hard and fast at a rate of 100 to 120 per minute. Allow full chest recoil.

prompts.title: Continue compressions
prompts.content: Continue CPR. Push hard and fast.

prompts.title: Continue compressions
prompts.content: Continue CPR. Push hard and fast.

prompts.title: Prepare to stop
prompts.content: Prepare to stop CPR. Do not touch the patient.

prompts.title: Re-analyze
prompts.content: Stop CPR. Do not touch the patient. Analyzing heart rhythm.
